definition: (literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages

sentences.english: Dantes listened to these melancholy tidings with outward calmness .
sentences.chinese: 丹特斯聽取這些傷心的消息時外表很鎮靜。

sentences.english: The researchers undertook the study, he said, after hearing stories anecdotally from medical students about their educational experiences.
sentences.chinese: 他說，調查人員聽取醫學生描述教育經歷後進行分析。

sentences.english: I have listened closely to your concerns.
sentences.chinese: 我認真聽取了你們的關注。

sentences.english: A: I've come about your offer for bristles.
sentences.chinese: 我今天來訪的目的是想聽取你方對豬鬃的報盤。

sentences.english: Place your pencil where it says START and listen to morse code.
sentences.chinese: 請將您的鉛筆如果說階段，並聽取莫爾斯電碼。

sentences.english: When they debrief you, that's the story you'll tell.
sentences.chinese: 當他們聽取你的彙報時，那就是你要講述的故事。

sentences.english: Governor Zhou listened to brief introduction in Wealth Management Center.
sentences.chinese: 周強省長在財富管理中心聽取情況介紹。

sentences.english: You can get feedback from a friend.
sentences.chinese: 你可以從朋友那裏聽取意見。

sentences.english: The court heared a report from the probation officer.
sentences.chinese: 法院聽取了監督緩刑官員的彙報。

sentences.english: Idei, the Guo heard of the company's safety briefing.
sentences.chinese: 出井後，郭海聽取了該公司的安全生產情況彙報。

sentences.english: The court is also expected to hear major cases involving free speech and privacy.
sentences.chinese: 法院也將聽取涉及言論自由和隱私的大案要案。

sentences.english: The astronauts were briefed on the weather situation before they left.
sentences.chinese: 在離開前，他們聽取了天氣情況彙報。

sentences.english: Ask questions and listen to answers.
He was obdurate in his refusal to listen to our complaints.
sentences.chinese: 他在他的頑固拒絕聽取我們的投訴。

sentences.english: I have also listened attentively to the statements made by Mr. de Kermabon and Mr. Hyseni.
sentences.chinese: 我也認真聽取了德科爾馬邦先生和海森尼先生的發言。

definition: to advance/to conduct/underway/in progress/to do/to carry out/to carry on/to execute
to implement/to carry out/to execute/to run
